intro: Mertensia incongruens, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its showy flowers and sometimes hairy foliage. Mertensia incongruens is a perennial herb that thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil.
